author: Special Correspondent
text:
The National Lok Adalat held here on Saturday settled 1,361 cases and ordered to pay Rs. 4.05 crore as compensation.

An official statement said the Adalat, formally inaugurated by Additional District Judge A. Abdul Khader, took 7,420 cases for consideration and disposed of 1,361 cases through negotiations and the parties concerned with these cases accepted to pay Rs. 4.05 crore as compensation.

A total of ten sessions heard the cases during the Adalat.

District Legal Services Authority Judge Thamizharasi had made arrangements for the Adalat.

Thoothukudi

As many as 110 cases were settled at the National Lok Adalat held across the district. Principal District Judge N. Rajasekar presided over the adalat. A total of 1,341 cases were taken up through 9 benches. During the schedule, cases concerning bank matters and Section 138 of Negotiable Instrument Act, pre-litigation cases were taken up for settlement. Of 1,290 bank cases, 65 were settled and Rs. 54, 02,850 was awarded as compensation. Besides, 51 pending cases were taken up for disposal and 45 were settled, sources from District Legal Services Authority said.
title: Lok Adalat held
